author: Emily Ng
text: 'best mutz sandwich in town\ninstagram: emilyeatsat'

author: Vincent Padula (Vince)
text: "I didn't think the sandwich wasn't up to my tasting sandwich is small I bought a Sinatra sandwich it was small for 13 dollars you go to m+ p Giacomo up the block there sandwiches are huge and not even over priced you get big sandwich for the price but Vito's puts to much salami like there giving it away and I never heard any body in a deli call there mozzarella mutz I'm Italian and we never called it that this a new thing to me but I will never go back maybe Hoboken thinks thats fine they think it's great sandwich but I won't be going back sorry but you gotta make a bigger sandwich for the price bread wasn't good  but every body has different taste this is not my taste if you wanna spend on a small sandwich for the price and I didn't like the smokey taste on the sandwich wish you the best it's not my best 🥖🥖🤣🤣😭😭😴😴🥲😤😤😡😡😡😞😞😞👎👎👎👎"

text: 'LadyAbi Coach:💯👍❤️ SuperNice SuperGood\nThe Best Legacy Subs.\nLove it ❤️'

text: 'Always good food
column5: always cool people'

author: Ian Pizzolo
text: 'Best sandwich and mutz in town'

text: 'Amazing and amazing 🇮🇹'

text: 'bro i got moldy bread
column5: got sick'

text:

author: John Bing
text: 'Been going there for years..the roast beef and mutz...omg...they got it to a science...I reward the crew after every completed reno...alway great food ..always great service...jtb'

author: Jessica Maio
text: 'today I had the pleasure of stopping in this deli during work hours. I had came all the way from Fairfield and brought the sandwiches back to the office and let me tell you… this is amazing!!! Great customer service
column5: well worth it!!!!! Also thank you for the cannoli on the side
column6: you all are absolutely amazing !!!! <3'

author: Vanessa Ibarrondo
text: 'Went there for the first time. Heard they are the best mutz...the sandwiches are decent sizes and was good.  The mutz was good but not the best. We tried the place in Bronx
column5: little Italy section and theirs is amazing.  Vito did not compare!'

author: Elizabeth Wasserman
text: 'This is a great Italian deli in Hoboken. They have a lot of options for sandwiches and sides. Sides are so important to me. I got 2 sandwiches with chicken cutlet and they were both great. Delicious broccoli rabe and mozzarella.'

author: just tara
text: 'Definitely a good Italian spot to go to. I got a few roast beef and mozz sandwiches
column5: fresh mozz and prosciutto. All of it was on point
column6: the staff was extremely friendly
column7: efficient and fast. The store has a wide variety of items
column8: very fresh food and well stocked.'

author: Joe Doran
text: "Fantastic hero's and the best Mutz in NJ.  Swear by the Vito's Hero as best in city."

author: Robert Koch
text: 'Can’t handle high volume easily. Only go after 2pm'

author: Kristen Dionne
text: 'Can’t go wrong with takeout from this classic Italian deli. In my opinion
column5: they have the best mutz in town- ultra fresh
column6: and they have it in the smoked variety as well! I have tried their chicken cutlet sandwich with fresh mutz
column7: marinated peppers and pesto and it was just so spot on
column8: especially with the perfectly crisp Italian hoagie roll it came on. The Soprano sandwich (same concept except switch out the chicken with some fresh
column9: hand cut Italian meats) also knocked it out of the ballpark for me. EVERYTHING is good here

author: James Peterson
text: 'Best mozz and prosciutto ever'

author: Joseph Aubourg
text: 'Great deli and service'

author: jon
text: 'Great neighborhood deli! Employees are very nice and make you laugh. The chicken cutlet sandwich was incredible.'

author: Tommy DeSimone
text: "Just stopped in for a couple of sandwiches. Toward the end if the day.  Staff couldn't have been more friendly - did not get rushed. Service with a smile."

author: NSA
text: 'Love love love the fresh mozzarella sandwiches made here. used to be very happy to be working in Hoboken just to eat here\n\nwas cash only
column5:
not sure if it still is

I loved getting some Italian crackers as well when I was there

staff is really kind and friendly
column6: highly recommend'

author: Rebecca Minacapelli
text: 'I have become obsessed with Vito’s. The subs are just that good. I can feel the pesto coursing through my veins.'

author: Lisa Marie
text: 'Horrible service. Placed an online order and it was cancelled because they “don’t take any orders during the last hour of business.” I’ve never heard of such a thing
column5: awful business model. Close down the site before taking someone’s money for an order your going to cancel. I’ll never support this deli again with so many other options in town that actually value their customers.'

author: R O
text: 'Best mutz in town for me. Love the hot roast beef (w/mutz and gravy).  My go to deli in Hoboken.'

author: The Eow
text: 'Love this spot
column5: came back for a visit after moving away five years ago and the food & customer service is awesome as it always was! Vito’s forevaaaa. The veggie omelette is my go-to'

author: Jonathan Pepe
text: "Tied with Fiore's in my opinion for best sandwich in town. Everything on the menu is great
column5: but the simple stuff is my favorite. The quality of all the ingredients really shine. Plus
column6: they take a credit card and deliver. Staff are all friendly and efficient. There's this one guy who works there...his sandwiches look like a picture of a sandwich

author: Luna G
text: 'My favorite Deli store in Hoboken!\n\nHave to say I like their roasted beef mutz with gravy hero more than Fiore’s
column5: and they have it available any day! Really good selection of subs and the service is really friendly and efficient. They also got a nice freezer with tons of homemade ready-to-cook dishes.\n\nCannot wait to come back and try more things on the menu!'

author: Joe Diaz
text: 'Same great sandwich from my days at Stevens many years ago.'

author: Mary Perryman
text: "Dear Vito
column5: each and every time I visit your deli
column6: it's like no time has passed
column7: immediately feel at home and that I am visiting family.  Everything in your deli
column8: from the out of this world exceptional food
column10: is beyond what I could describe in words.  I cannot thank you enough for all you have done for my family over the years and with your entire team following your lead and in your footsteps
column11: your tradition will carry on for years to come! And speaking of an  amazing team
column12: I recently met Raysa who is so incredibly thoughtful
column16: I am fortunate to have had her support with my orders
column17: and I wanted you to know how amazing she is!! Thank you again for everything and looking forward to visiting again soon!!!!!!! With warmest regards

author: Cydney B
text: 'I ordered the Italian
column5: veggie & cookie/cannolis platters to surprise my new (& Italian) son-in-law + a few items like pesto
column6: fresh mozzarella & tarallis.  My son-in-law said it was the best mozzarella & cannolis he ever had & was sending photos to his dad.  My vegan daughter loved the marinated artichoke hearts & that the veggies were on a bed of marinated arugula.  The pepperoni was shaped in a rose pattern.  Phenomenal personal service & presentation.  Thank you for a special family experience

author: Matt Reihl
text: "The.soprano.( That's all that needs to be said. )"

author: Pétros
text: "They make great sandwiches. You won't regret it. 😋"

author: Matthew Hanson
text: 'One of the best Italian sandwiches in NYC region. Hoboken for the win!!'

author: Michael Pizza
text: 'I go there for there Sandwiches which in my opinion are the best in town.'

author: Elizabeth D'Amato
text: 'Mozzarella Roasted Red Pepper Sandwich was incredible. Their cannoli was also one of the best I’ve had.'

author: Gina Bucchiano
text: 'This is the best place! The people behind the counter always seem happy! Best mutz in hoboken!!'

author: Arlene Kersley
text: 'Sitting home during lockdown II near London
column5: dreaming of the next time we can get to Vitos.'

author: Michael Atkins
text: 'Italian food and the scene at this location is great. it was so tasty. i had a cousin come into town and asked me to take him back here. feels similar to a cafe in chicago i loved.'

author: Michele Petrucelli
text: 'Oh my!!! This place is absolutely amazing! Old school Italian style food. One of the best sandwiches I\'ve had in my life! Try the "Garden State" Sandwich w/Grilled Chicken 😘 Friendly & fast service & delicious food! THANKS VITO\'S💜'

author: Golden Management Group
text: 'Vito’s special sandwich was a major YUM!  There was a long line to get to the sandwich but it was totally worth it!  I was one happy person after eating this sandwich!!  Would totally do it again!  One craving down~ YUM!!!'

author: michael powers
text: 'Great deli sandwiches and best mutz'

author: Michael Tesalona
text: 'Just the best. The best. The best. Get a sandwich w mozz- any sandwich - you won’t be disappointed. My fav is roast beef mozz and gravy. Also... cannoli.'

author: Alex Varela
text: 'Nice place delicious Italian food. Friendly people'

author: Thomas Steitz
text: 'Fresh food is excellent and love the menu options. Knock 1 star for quality of cold cuts / occasionally sub-excellent bread.'

author: John Garrabrant
text: 'Great sandwich action limousine inc'

author: Kyle Gehan
text: 'Best mutz just as advertised'

author: julian delpino
text: 'To be honest this review could easily come down to one word "WOW."\n\nAmidst all the deli options in Hoboken
column5: hands down they\'re the best. First and foremost I don\'t care what anyone says they have the best MUTZ (Mozzarella) in Hoboken...sorry Fiore this is not intended to downplay other good businesses
column6:
but these guys are the real deal.

I work for Citibank and we had an event for my employees where I decided to work with the best deli in town and I have always got catering from them for my teams Christmas parties.

The owner and his son are awesome and I asked them if they could do a sandwich in the shape of my business name
column7: "Citi." They said they would make it happen for me. My employees
column8: my boss and people from other branches even came to my office to visit because they heard we got food from Vito\'s.\n\nI was a business banker before being a branch manager and let me tell you this place is ran very well and produce such good quality. Their pasta salad was delicious
column9: every sandwich we tasted was so fresh and you could tell they make their food with such care. I could go on and on
column10: but I want to thank Vito and his son Danny for being professional and making food that makes you feel good. If you’re in Hoboken check it out.'

author: Jessica Collazo
text: 'This is the best sandwich shop in Hoboken. Go to Vito’s and you won’t be disappointed :)'

author: Sara Lin
text: "The mutz (fresh-made mozzarella cheese) here is to die for
column5: Vito's is a Hoboken classic!"

author: Alex Sacchetti
text: 'The very very best subs in Hoboken go with the vitos classic!'

author: George Ramos
text: "What could I say about Hoboken old time delis? Mama mia the best! I had not been to Vito's in years  and I regret that. I ordered Genoa salami
column5: roasted  peppers and fresh mozzarella sandwich. What else do you need? I unraveled the foil to reveal a succulent beautiful beast of a sandwich that took two seating to devour. This picture says it all."

author: Mary Holmberg
text: 'Sandwiches are amazing!! Takes a long time to get food though'

author: john kersley
text: "Simply the best deli on the planet... I live in the UK but I want my last meal to be a hoagie from Vito's"

author: Michael Dimond
text: 'Great food.  Wife had chicken parm hero.  I had roast beef and mutz.  Mmmmmmm'

author: Joey
text: "I have been coming here for well over 10 years and not once have I been disappointed.  Roast beef and mutz is the shizzz. Vito's special is also slammin! Honestly i cant say I've had any bad sandwich here
column5: hot or cold."

author: Olek Buzunov
text: 'Fantastic food.'

author: Thomas Shell
text: 'Quality!'

author: Jason F
text: "Authentic deli with great mutz
column5: fresh ingredients and huge sandwiches.  They also have a wide selection of Italian specialties and sides. Can get a bit hectic and intimidating for a first timer on the weekends so be prepared to order when you're called. However
column6: the staff is always efficient in getting you in and out in a timely manner. One of the better delis in Hoboken
column7: but I prefer Biancamano up the street."

author: Vincent Eugenio
text: 'Best mutz in hoboken'

text: 'Best variety
column5: and friendly staff...\nBest egg sandwich I ever had.'

author: Suzanne Garrow
text: 'Best Sub on the planet. The Vito is my favorite but the roast is great too. I miss living in Hoboken and drive from Vermont often. I still dream of Vitos.'

text: 'Amazing!!'

text: "The greatest deli in the world.  You can't go wrong here.  The best fresh mutz

author: JaneMarie Perez-Breijo
text: "The classic ham and mutz
column5: the Vito's Special... the sandwiches are amazing.  They have good hot food and imported specialties from Italy too.  A little pricey sometimes
column6: but so worth it. Been going there for more than 20 years."

author: Ron R
text: 'Unbelievable MUTZ'

author: Joe Anthony
text: 'Order a grilled chicken sandwich with sautéed spinach and provolone. Had no idea this was going to be served refrigerator cold. They must make the chicken in the morning and then put it in the fridge. Idk if people like grilled chicken sandwiches cold like that but I definitely don’t. On top of that
column5: a few hours later my stomach was boiling. Some bad chicken or something.\n\nGave it a two because the people were nice.'

text: 'Great Mutz'

text: 'Very nice staff and of course delicious food'

text: 'Very good food to pick up and go.. 😋😋😋'

text: 'Food was incredible! And wow the portions 😍'

author: Dee khilall
text: "I ordered on dashdoor and it didn't show any urgency in filling my order.  I went to pick up my order 15 mins later waited an extra 10 mins while the workers were taking walk in customer coming in after me.  At one point they ask if I needed help and when I told them I'm waiting for my sandwich that's when he took my order and made it.  I should have just walk into the store and order a sandwich I would have gotten serve sooner."

text: "Ate their vito's and it was really great! Great value For money!"

author: David H
text: "Excellent food. Great people working there they treat like family. They make u feel welcome also so clean I'll give a perfect 10 👍 👍"

author: Marcello D'Aureli
text: "Solid deli spot. When I find parking it's a must. Don't forget to try the mozzerella on your hero."

author: Slagathor
text: "There's always a problem with the short girl ringing me out. She always charges more for things that nobody else charges for.  Idk what her problem is but everyone should stay away when she's working and hopefully this review will help get her fired!"

author: Lizvet Turcios
text: 'I love this place!! The food is always amazing and great staff! Best fresh mozzarella ever!'

author: Carmen Kath
text: 'It was my first time at this place and it was just delicious. The man ahead of me ordered something that sounded amazing so I ordered the same. It was amazing.... phenomenal. The people that work there are very nice
column5: and seem like they enjoy their jobs. I will definitely come back next time I am in Hoboken.\nMy mind is so blown by the fact that my sweet peppers didn’t come out of a can. Do you have any idea how delicious this little detail makes a meal so 100% perfect. GO TO THIS PLACE!\nYou’re missing out on the best things in life and honestly the best cannoli I have had in a while came from here. You guys!!! AMAZING.'

author: john moore
text: 'Top shelf food n service!!!'

text: 'Yum! Happy Hour Specials were huge

text: 'This deli has gone down significantly over the years.  They are over priced plus they charge 5% on all credit card and debit card transactions. Not to mention they have gotten my last 5 orders wrong. Save yourself some aggrevation and try Fiores or m & p biancamano instead.'

"Haven't tried the sub yet but they charged me 4% extra when i asked her If i could charge it. U have plenty of cash. If there was a surcharge it wouldve been nice to let me know your charging me and i just wouldve paid cash. Poor customer experience which means the bad taste in my mouth won't be fixed by the food regardless of how good or awful it is."

text: 'Had a great Italian combo here. Bread was perfect

text: 'The Mozzarella is unbelievably good and you get a pretty good amount for $12. They are known as having the best around and it certainly will not disappoint.\n\nThe sandwiches are awesome and again a great value. Can be a decent line however as this is s hotspot in Hoboken. Looking forward to trying some of their pre-made sides and some of their frozen dinners.'

text: 'Vito\'s is a little overpriced. I ordered the Parma

text: "Vito's is one of the few really good delis in town. They can be expensive but the food is really good."

text: "First time

column6: nice staff!! Get in early & beat the crowds!'

author: Chris Lau
text: 'Best sandwiches in town'

author: John Otranto
text: "Everything I've had at Vito's is outstanding. Staff is very friendly and prices are good."

author: Mundeep Basi
text: "Vito's hot.  That is all you need to say when you get there.  Old school Italian deli
column5: been coming here since my college days."

author: S T
text: 'Best.  Sandwich.  Ever.   Get the Sinatra with garlic spread
column5: go now.  Now.'

author: Adam Rubinstein
text: 'Best mozz this side of the Hudson.'

author: Brian
text: 'Excellent Italian Deli. Try the Mutz.'

author: Kyra Pastore
text: 'They have decent sandwiches but it is far from the best deli in Hoboken. Definitely less authentic and more expensive for what you get.'

author: Greg Whipple
text: 'Prosciutto de parma is excellent. Great service. Will make it a regular stop'

author: David Jaslow
text: 'Vito makes the best pasta sauce in the United States!'

author: David G
text: "Greatest Italian deli on the planet. The mutz is delicious.   They have been making it for 4 generations and it shows. The prosciutto di Parma is off the charts. The best I've ever had. Worth the price tag. I never miss it when in Hoboken. Parking is an issue"

author: Travela Sol
text: "The homemade mozzarella is the best. It's not mozzarella di buffala but still great. The cannoli are great as well."

author: Joe Moogy
text: "I've been coming to Vito's Deli in Hoboken for over 20 years and I've yet to have a bad sandwich.  The fresh Mutz is the best around.  I bring my kids here so they can experience a real authentic Italian deli."

author: Stephanie Tom
text: 'The sandwiches are so good!'

author: Purvin Patel
text: 'Great food'

author: Joseph Bellantuono
text: 'I enjoyed the fresh mozzarella a lot & the imported stuff!'

author: Joseph Tiseo
text: 'Some of the best sandwiches.  The home made mozzarella is amazing.'

author: Nancy Bowman
text: 'Best deli in Hoboken! Award-winning sandwiches and mozzarella.  Heroes are out of this world. Astounding salads
column5: hot food and specials. Italian delicacies you can only find in Italy.  Pesto of my dreams! Try the dried tomato or olive spread and the "to die for" pasta salad. Great catering
column6: great service

author: Justin Levine
text: "Without getting into too much detail
column5: I had pick up 17 sandwiches for some very hungry people at Stevens Tech
column6: and since this was the nearest of the old school Italian delis in Hoboken
column7: I decided to come here.  The place looked like a modernized version of Fiore's
column8: with a constantly long line to match.  The staff was very friendly and accommodating
column9: and the full selection of items was second to none.  Although the sandwiches won acclaim from everyone who got one
column10: I'll stick to commenting on what I got.  I got a special with mixed grilled veggies (eggplant
column17: and I also added some homemade roast beef.  The bread here was by far the best part
column18: as it was delicious and perfect for a sandwich.  The mozzarella was great (not quite as good as Fiore
column20: as was the roast beef.  The veggies could've been better however
column21: as the grill gave them a generic smoky flavor which obscured their normal flavors.  Also
column22: they went light on the veggies
column23: as I also saw with one order I placed for a regular veggie special.  This was a great sandwich
column24: and while its not the best I've had even in Hoboken
column25: it is definitely worth a special detour."

author: Tiffany Moy
text: "STAY AWAY - DO NOT COME HERE!\n\nI purchased a $5 for $10 coupon through LivingSocial for Vitos. Right before it expired last week
column5: I went to visit Vitos to use it but they were closed all week long for vacation. They were opening the deli back after the coupon expired (suspicious
column6: right?). Thinking that they'd honor the coupon the following week since they closed their establishment for a full week without warning. Well that was not the case. They only would honor the $5 I paid for the coupon. This was not only disappointing since I go to Vitos all the time without a coupon but this not my fault as I couldn't use the coupon before it expired since they closed the deli!!! They should have honored my coupon - instead of throwing a fuss
column7: I just used the stupid $5 I put in plus a little more (b/c i just wanted to get a sandwich and get out). I will never come here again and spend a penny here. I will tell all my friends
column9: coworkers and anyone else that will listen in Hoboken
column11: and New York City to NEVER come here. Instead I recommend going to Fiores on Adams st
column13: or even Tony Bolognas on First - they have better sandwiches anyway.\n\nHow dare they pull a fast one on their customers like that. They have absolutely no respect for their customers. Yes
column15: but they also forget customers like me come to Vitos many times without one. Way to retain your customers Vitos. You should learn some retention marketing and maybe also get some lessons in customer service.\n\nNEVER EAT HERE!!!"

author: MLB MLB
text: "We went on a Sunday for lunch - the place was packed with a line out the door.  When it was our turn to order I mentioned how busy they were and the gentleman behind the counter said it was always this busy....so they must be doing something right
column5: right?  I had the Sinatra Hero and my daughter had the Vito's Hero - both were excellent.  For dessert we each had a cannoli; my daughter's first.  We totally recommend this place…and will visit again."

author: Helen Kourlos
text: "I must have had Vito's everyday for most of my senior year of college. You can't find a deli like this anywhere else! they have an amazing roasted pepper spread that's great on any sandwich. this place is by far way better than the other deli's in the area.\n\nAlso
column5: the staff there is great! and try to get there before or after the lunch hour bc I've seen the line out the door on several occasions!"

author: Chris Combe
text: 'best sandwiches in town
column5: love it'

author: The Corcoran Group
text: 'Fresh muzz and excellent Italian sandwiches. Try the hot roast beef
column5: muzz and gravy.'

author: Nick Walker
text: "I can't get enough Vito's. Best deli in Hoboken and they deliver. What more could you ask for!"
